alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 6:10PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SHERIDAN COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM MDT... At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Chadron to near Hay Springs to 7 miles northwest of Antioch. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Rushville, Hay Springs, Antioch, White Clay, Clinton, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Intersection of Beaver Creek Road and White Clay Creek Road, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road, Smith Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Mount Maria, Highway 250 crossing the Niobrara River, Walgren Lake State Recreation Area, Snow Lake, Pine Ridge, Wickson Lake, Diamond Lake, Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area, Krause Lake, Intersection of Highway 87 and Antelope Road and Argo Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 74 and 100. Highway 250 between mile markers 8 and 48. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
